Line.Text: Is that Daniel?
I’m the one who says “Hello” here! I’m also the one who asks questions.
Yes. Who am I talking to?
Eh… okay. Can I help you with something? Oh, that was a question… sorry.
Hello, Daniel. My name is Michael. I’m a representative of LIFE+, and I work to resolve the incident that's happened to Ashley.
I’m an investigator from LIFE+. I hope you know why we’re having this conversation.
Oh, crap. It wasn’t me, man! I haven’t done nothing!
Denying things right from the start only confirms your suspicious behavior.
I will be the judge of that. For now, I need you to calm dawn and cooperate.
Relax, kid. I’m not your enemy. I’m here to figure out the truth, nothing more.
But… but… ugh, just do your worst. I’m a dead man anyway.
Okay. Uh… I’ll try to do that. Both to calm down and to cooperate, I mean… right. Uh… I’ll shut up now.
Really? That’s great. I worked myself up when I got that scary message, to be honest…[pause] didn’t even hope a big shot like you could actually be nice.
Not much faith in your friendly corporate overlords?
Why not? Should working for a corporation make me less human?

Ha-ha, no, I have faith in corporate overlords, just not in their friendliness. Actually, if you don’t mind me asking…[pause] what’s it like to work at a high position for such a huge company? I’ve always wanted to get a job at some big corp.

Oh, no, I didn’t mean it that way. If anything, it should make you more human. Actually, if you don’t mind me asking…[pause] what’s it like to work at a high position for such a huge company? I’ve always wanted to get a job at some big corp.
I think you have zero chances at that.
You mistake me for someone else, kid. I’m not even officially employed.
Eh…
You don’t have to tell me, I’m not even aiming so high… but still, what’s it like?
You’re still important enough to lead this investigation, so you must have a much better idea than me. So, what’s it like?
Just curious, you know.
Not much different from anywhere else, I guess… just people trying to do their jobs. Some hate it, some marry it, some try to find balance as best as they can.

It’s horrible. In big companies, people are not people, they’re cogs. Bureaucracy dehumanizes everything, no matter how well-intentioned the higher-ups are. You do not want to pursue a career in the corporate sector, trust me.
It’s pretty awesome. You get to solve the most important problems of the world along with the most talented people in the world, and get paid handsomely for it. What’s not to like?
Really? That’s quite different from how I imagined… but thanks for telling me. And hey, shoot me any questions you want.
Boy, do I want to get a piece of that one day… thanks for telling me. And hey, shoot me any questions you want.
Hello? Oh, it’s you again…
Do you know why you are under suspicion?
Tell me about your relationship with Ashley.
What is your role in the team?
What do you think about the incident?
All right, lover boy, I think it’s time we both agree that you’re guilty.
Let’s take a break.

Of course I do! It’s because I managed to screw up right before this thing happened. Asked her to be my girlfriend, got rejected, couldn’t deal with it properly…[pause] so now you think I hired hackers and wrote that post to get back at her. Or asked a hacker friend. Or even hacked it myself, as if I know how to do that…
Hacked? Why would you need to hack it?
Of course you don’t, hacking is way too complicated for someone like you. But you knew her password, so there was no need.
Uh… why wouldn’t I? How else can you write something under someone else’s name?
Oh, I don’t know. Maybe knowing the account’s password helps?
Password? Well, yeah, actually, she told me her password so I could quickly try out that library of scents… what does this have to do with anything?
One’s password gives access to one’s account. One’s account is used to write posts in one’s blog. Pretty simple, isn’t it?
Look, kid. Playing dumb is a cheap trick. Don’t make more troubles than you’re already in.
Do you feign ignorance on purpose, or are you just that much of an idiot?
Sure, but how… wait. You mean I could’ve used the same password and went to her blog instead of the library? Oh.
But I really don’t understand… wait. You mean I could’ve used the same password and go to her blog instead of the library? Oh.
You are as clueless in cybersecurity matters as Ashley, are you?
If playing for time is all you plan to do, you chose a very bad strategy.
Ugh… why am I even having this conversation? This is supposed to be the future. I feel like I’m in the 90s and work in customer support.
Ashley? Clueless? If you call Ash clueless, I wonder what that makes me…
Yeah, I don’t think the right word has been invented yet.
Thanks for saying that out loud, mister…
Yeah, thanks for saying that out loud, mister. It’s not like I’m in denial or anything…
I’m not playing for time! How would that even help me? Oh, this is a mess…
Eh… what, sorry?

Do you really need to ask that? Your friends said that my screw-up was recorded and is now available for everyone to watch…[pause] and it’s not like they had to mention that. Pretty much everything is monitored by cameras these days.
Just tell me your version.

I don’t have a “version,” nor do I have any excuses. What you saw is what had happened. Ashley and I were friends… well, maybe that’s because she’s so nice to everyone that you just feel like being her friend… but then I pushed too far too fast.[pause] Boyd asked me to do the special effects for the rest of the season, and it’s a big pain in the ass, but it also meant I got to work closely with Ashley, so I grabbed the opportunity.[clear]She showed me the basics on that meet-up day; we were alone, shared some nice moments, had a good laugh… so I thought, this is it, now or never. I need to make a move.
Does this mean you had feelings for her?
How long have you been romantically interested in Ashley?

Of course! I fell for her right when I joined this team, and I’ve stayed this long only because of that. Which wasn’t very long, to be fair…[pause] but still enough time to get serious. Or at least not flat-out reject me the moment I opened my mouth. It’s just not fair.

Pretty much since we first met. I fell for her the moment I joined this team, and I’ve stayed this long only because of that. Which wasn’t very long, to be fair…[pause] but still enough time to get serious. Or at least not flat-out reject me the moment I opened my mouth. It’s just not fair.
So you admit that you hold a grudge against her.
So you decided to keep insisting until it turned into harassment.
Yes! Only I never thought about the harassment part. I’m an idiot, all right? Being an idiot is not a crime.
It’s not an excuse either.
I’d say it’s an offense.
But I tried to apologize! The very same evening, I returned and said that I’m sorry.
No! I… I tried to apologize! The very same evening, I returned and said that I’m sorry.
And how did that work out for you?
Yes, to avert suspicion.
That doesn’t mean much. You still have the most obvious motive among the suspects.

It worked well. At least I thought it did, but then this weird incident happened, and we haven’t talked since, and…[pause] oh, I’m screwed. Even if you don’t arrest me, I’m never gonna see my beautiful Ashley again.
No! Why would I do this? How could I even plan something like this? I’m too dumb!
Oh, you’d want me to believe that, wouldn’t you? Playing dumb is your best bet now. Your only bet.
Either way, it’s not something that can clear your suspect status.
No, I’m not playing at all! Shouldn’t you detective guys be able to tell between a real idiot and a fake one? You’ve got to believe me, please!
I know, I know…
I know, I know… man, how did I get into this mess…
Just little things here and there, really… this is more of a transitional phase for me. I want to find a real job.
And what qualifies as a “real job”?
A boring job, then.
If you are so uncommitted, why stay on the team at all?
So you weren’t taking things very seriously.
Did it ever cause friction between you and other team members?
Did it ever cause friction between you and Ashley?
Fine, another question.
Something more substantial. With salary, benefits, career opportunities…
Real jobs aren’t supposed to be fun. But they’re supposed to bring you money so you can have fun when you’re not working.
Isn’t it obvious? Because I like Ashley, and this was the easiest way to get closer. Much good it did me in the end…
No, I suppose I wasn’t.
Occasionally, yes. It’s not like I don’t understand them…[pause] it’s frustrating when others are ambivalent about something you treasure a lot. But I also can’t force myself to care.
Yes… though she was always very polite about it. Why?
Nothing you should worry about.
Just trying to understand your relationship better.
Just piling up the reasons why you’re guilty.
If you say so…
Okay…
Oh, great…
It’s weird. Why would anyone do this?
You should try to be more informative if you really want to cooperate.
You tell me.
Perhaps they were rejected by a girl and got a bit frustrated?
Sorry… but I honestly at a loss. It seems like a very convoluted way to bully someone.
Please, I don’t know about this any more than you do. Actually, I know much less.
Maybe. Oh, wait, you mean me… please stop doing this. It’s hard not to freak out as it is.
Aren’t you a little bit worried about Ashley?
Of course I am! Did she… did she really consider suicide?
Yes! Haven’t you read her blog?
No… still, she was shaken to the core.
But why? Ashley is so skillful, I’m sure she can find another job in no time.
She doesn’t want “another job.” She’s already found her perfect job, that’s the point.
Is that all you think about? Jobs? She found more than a job here. She found people who care about her efforts.
I really think you should do the explaining here, not the other way around.

How could it be perfect if people wanted her gone in the end?[pause] See, that’s another thing I don’t understand: either viewers like you, or they don’t. How can a single mistake tip the scales so seriously and suddenly?
But people wanted her gone in the end.[pause] See, that’s another thing I don’t understand: either viewers like you, or they don’t. How can a single mistake tip the scales so seriously and suddenly?

Sorry, I just find it hard to understand her sometimes. Strangely enough, it makes me like her even more.[pause] Here’s something else I don’t understand, though: either viewers like you, or they don’t. How can a single mistake tip the scales so seriously and suddenly?
Maybe it was the last straw. Still, it was the false last straw, so the impostor is responsible for the whole thing.
People are impulsive and easily manipulated; even the smallest things can give them the wrong idea.
Trying to understand how could your little prank go so terribly wrong?
Man, it’s complicated… I hope she’ll be okay.
What? No, it wasn’t my prank! Why are you making this so hard?
What? No, wait!
But it’s clear as day. You had a reason to be mad at Ashley, and an instant access to getting your little revenge. Such an easy way to vent the frustration, it was impossible to resist.
I’m serious. You and even others may want it to be more complicated, but it really isn’t. You tried to get the girl, failed, got bitter, and did the stupid thing. End of story.
Hold that thought, we’ll return to it shortly.
But I didn’t even consider that, I barely know how these accounts work… I… I tried to explain!
But it’s wrong, just a stupid coincidence… I… I tried to explain!
That thought pretty much haunts me by now…

You think I can’t see through your “explanations”? You may be able to turn on “the good guy mode,” but you’re self-centered to the core – and dangerously clueless. You probably didn’t think fake posting would take things so far. You just did it on impulse.

Your answers do not convince me; all I see is an egotistic boy. No matter what you talk about, it’s all filled with “I’s.” “I have,” “I did,” “I want”… You don’t take other people’s feelings into consideration. You can hurt another person without even realizing… and that’s exactly what happened.

No, you did the opposite; you tried to confuse me. You feigned ignorance on every possible occasion. But I don’t buy it. I think you understand much more than you pretend to, and you knew exactly how to get away with it. But you’re not getting away with it. Not on my watch.

I should have seen it coming… it was stupid to think I can change anybody’s mind.[pause] Go on then, do your worst. If you want to arrest me, arrest me. Just don’t bother me with this conversation any longer, all right? It’s a waste of time anyway.
Don’t worry, I won’t.
Hello? Oh, it’s you… decided to have a talk one last time before telling your friend to arrest me?
Why would I arrest you?
Depends on how good your explanation will be.
Pretty much.
Because you found out about the pictures and now think I’m a creep?
There is nothing wrong with having pictures of the girl you like on the wall.
I wouldn’t arrest you just for that. However, it’d be nice to hear some explaining.
Don’t worry, I thought you were a creep from the very beginning.

When she’s your girlfriend, perhaps… but no, I admit it. I used to print out Ashley’s photos and hang them on my wall. Stared at them for hours on end… until the day she rejected me.[pause] That day, I came back home and began to tear them apart. But I regretted it almost immediately. I put the pieces back together, then ran back to the library and apologized to her.

Well, that’s reassuring… but I admit it. I used to print out Ashley’s photos and hang them on my wall. Stared at them for hours on end… until the day she rejected me.[pause] That day, I came back home and began to tear them apart. But I regretted it almost immediately. I put the pieces back together, then ran back to the library and apologized to her.
Oh, I can explain everything! I know you found out about the pictures and think I’m a creep, but I’m not, I promise!
At least let me try to explain… I know you found out about the pictures and think I’m a creep, but I’m not, honestly.
Talk, then.
Nah, I’m pretty sure you are. But go on, say what you wanted to say.

Well, it’s embarrassing, but I used to print out Ashley’s photos and hang them on my wall. Stared at them for hours on end… until the day she rejected me.[pause] That day, I came back home and began to tear them apart. But I regretted it almost immediately. I put the pieces back together, then ran back to the library and apologized to her.
If you regretted it, why take them off the wall at all?
And replacing Ashley with celebrities makes it better how?
Or maybe you just tried to cover it up. An empty space on the wall would’ve been more suspicious, right?
Yeah, I bet “staring” is not the only thing you did for hours on end.
Why bother fixing when you can just print it again?
A likely story. I’m sure the only real part is you tearing up Ashley’s pictures in rage. The rest is just another bunch of excuses.
Enough about that.

Because I had to let it go. Because I wanted to change. Because, when she accepted my apology, I looked back and realized what a creepy stalker I’d become…[pause] if I still wanted to be friends with Ashley, or have a healthy relationship with any girl, that had to stop.
Well, because they’re celebrities. They want you to stare at them, right? They make money off it.
No! Do you really think I considered any of this? I never imagined my failed romantic attempts would become the center of such attention.
Oh, do you have to say it out loud? It’s already embarrassing as it is…
Because I grew attached to them, and they were no longer mere print-outs? I know it’s stupid and sentimental, but that’s how it was for me.
They’re not excuses, it’s true. If only somebody could believe me for a change…
More questions?
